channel.title: Persistence and Escalation Mechanisms on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in Persistence and Escalation Mechanisms on Analyst

item.title: Collection
item.description: *There are a lot of techniques to become persistent on a Windows machine. You can refer to the persistence and escalation mechanisms article or look those up on the MITRE website. Although it’s important to know the artefacts themselves and the technique, it would be hard to collect them all manually. *

item.title: Boot Abuse
item.description: Linux Init is the process that spawns other processes and usually has pid 1. /etc/inittab can be used to set run level for the systems.

item.title: Config Abuse
item.description: Some persistence and escalation techniques don’t require an exploit but only a little tweaking of some config.

item.title: Elevation Control Abuse
item.description: Linux & macOS setuid and setgid Platforms: macOS, Linux MITRE: https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1548/001/ setuid or setgid bits set in UNIX.

item.title: Kernel
item.description: Linux LKM LKM for Linux. Drivers are one type of kernel extentions. XDG https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1547/013/ macOS kext kext for macOS.

item.title: Library Abuse
item.description: Windows DLL Search Order Hijacking üëë - require w permissions for Windows and Windows\System32. Detection:

item.title: Services
item.description: Services can be abused differently but are often used as escalation and persistence mechanisms.

item.title: Tasks Abuse
item.description: Windows ‚ùóÔ∏è Both at and schtasks.exe can create tasks remotely. üè∫ Artefacts: ü™µ Event Log: Task Scheduler Operational.

item.title: Tokens Misuse
item.description: MITRE: https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1134/001/, https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1134/, https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1134/002/, https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1134/003/, https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1134/004/, https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1134/005/ Actors: https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032/ Techniques: Token impersonalisation. runas or CreateProcessWithTokenW to create a process with the rights of another user.
